newsitem.title: UK: Southern Elec says it is not for sale.
newsitem.headline: Southern Elec says it is not for sale.

text.p: Regional electricity company Southern Electric Plc said on Friday that it was not for sale amid newspaper reports that generator PowerGen would consider an acquisition.
A company spokesman said Southern had been surprised at the articles, adding that it believed comments by PowerGen's chairman and chief executive Ed Wallis had been taken out of context.
"We have a strong independent growth strategy," he added. "We're not for sale".
PowerGen was last year blocked by the government on anti-competitive grounds from buying another REC -- Midlands Electricity.
PowerGen said on Thursday after reporting annual results that it was considering a big acquisition.

The Financial Times reported Wallis as saying: "As for buying Southern Electric, well, we have a new government and who knows if their view is the same as the past government or what? It's too early to say."
Southern is the last independent REC since its 11 peers were swept up in a wave of acquisitions that began in earnest in 1995.
